data.name: SubProcesoCreate037
data.value: It is required to categorize and identify the sub-process in one of the following categories: “Routines”: These are those sub-processes that are directly related to the recurring activities of the business (the granting of credits, the purchase of titles, the payment of payroll, etc.) . "Non-routine": These are those threads that meet two fundamental conditions. The first is that they are not related to the recurring activities of the business, and the second, that they are carried out periodically (calculation of depreciation, calculation of exchange differences, product inventories, etc.). "Estimation": These sub-processes are accompanied by subjective judgments or evaluations by each Entity (impairment test, calculation of provisions of all kinds, etc.).

data.name: SubProcesoCreate038
data.value: It is equivalent to the Commercial Circuit or Business Line to which the sub-process corresponds. In the case of support areas, they should be considered as such since at the time they could be part of several circuits. It should be noted that with the information on stages and sub-stages, a risk map could be built

data.name: SubProcesoCreate039
data.value: It corresponds to the initial stage to which each Circuit may belong, such as, for example, a Circuit related to the granting of some credit, this can be divided into several stages (Origination, Administration, etc.), so each circuit must be analyzed Stages involved

data.name: SubProcesoCreate040
data.value: It refers to all those areas that have a relevant link and that intervene throughout the sub-process, it is important to consider that the areas that are noted must be separated by a semicolon (;), in order to avoid problems of being able to visualize them clearly.

data.name: SubProcesoCreate041
data.value: It corresponds to a more detailed analysis of each stage, such as the Credit Circuit whose stage is the originating one could have the following sub-stages (Promotion, analysis, authorization, formalization, disposition, etc.)

data.name: SubProcesoCreate042
data.value: Computer applications that, where appropriate, are necessary for the development of the sub-process. In the case of applications considered relevant, the name of said application and its corresponding module must be noted. In the case of including several applications, they must be separated by a semicolon (;).

data.name: RiesgoSubProcesosIndex001
data.value: Matrix of Risks and Controls - Assigned Sub Processes

data.name: RiesgoRiesgos001
data.value: Matrix of Risks and Controls - Risks Associated with the Sub-Process

data.name: RiesgoCreate002
data.value: Risk and Control Matrix - Add Risk

data.name: RiesgoCreate006
data.value: It is made up of acronyms "R" which indicates that it is a risk, followed by "SP" indicating that it is a sub-process. It continues with 4 digits, which correspond to the thread code and 2 more digits that indicate the consecutive or risk number that we are working on. Risk coding example: RSP1010-02

data.name: RiesgoCreate007
data.value: It corresponds to a definition of what the risk is, (they are the events that can directly or indirectly generate an error, intentional or not) with an impact on the financial report. The risk event must be described including two components: a - What is the risk b - What is the consequence of it.

data.name: RiesgoCreate008
data.value: Define the applicable Factor for this risk.

data.name: RiesgoCreate010
data.value: They are the elements in which the risk can incur.

data.name: RiesgoCreate011
data.value: Once the Risk Typology Class has been identified in the previous criterion, the risk must be classified according to the element associated with each of these. The Event Class and Event Sub Type rows are related and the information must be consistent.

data.name: RiesgoCreate012
data.value: Once the Type of Event has been identified in the previous criteria, the risk must be classified according to the element associated with each of these. The Event Type and Sub Event Type rows are related and the information must be consistent

data.name: RiesgoCreate013
data.value: The probability of occurrence must be determined according to the following context: How many times is this activity executed within a given period of time (Frequency). How many times in the same period of time, is it likely that an error or failure occurs, regardless of the controls that exist to mitigate it. (Probability)

data.name: RiesgoCreate014
data.value: Define the classification of the risk to which it belongs.

data.name: RiesgoCreate015
data.value: The dimensions that could comprise the materialization of the identified risk. This must be determined in the independent of the type of impact High: The consequences of the risk that may be incurred would represent a situation of severe dimensions for the institution, client or third party. Moderate: There would be consequences for the bank, but these would be feasible to keep under some control. Low: The consequences or dimensions of the risk detonation would be few and of small magnitudes. Negligible: The consequences or dimensions of the risk would be practically imperceptible.

data.name: RiesgoCreate016
data.value: You must answer "YES" or "NO", in the event that the identified risk materializes, as long as it could directly or indirectly affect any of the income or equity accounts (debtors and creditors). For a logical reason, when the type of impact column indicates that there is an effect on Cost by corporate criteria, in this column the option “YES” should be noted.

data.name: RiesgoCreate017
data.value: It is the order with which the sub-process is related: Article of Law, Rule, Provision, Office, etc. Compulsory and provided or issued in the Laws in force or by authorities (SHCP, Banco de México, CNBV, etc.). and you can even mention the chapter of the manual of policies and procedures that is involved.

data.name: RiesgoCreate018
data.value: It corresponds to the terminology "End User Computers" whose purpose is to identify those spreadsheets, macros, systems, etc. That they are not under the control of the systems area and that due to their relevance it is necessary to establish certain controls (access, users, storage, etc.). Normally these EUCs are used to perform necessary calculations in certain operations of the entities (Reserve calculations, securities valuation, etc.)

data.name: RiesgoCreate027
data.value: The risk code is a required field.

data.name: RiesgoCreate028
data.value: The risk event is a required field.

data.name: RiesgoCreate029
data.value: Risk type is a required field.

data.name: RiesgoCreate030
data.value: The risk typology class is a required field.

data.name: RiesgoCreate031
data.value: The risk typology subclass is a required field.

data.name: RiesgoCreate032
data.value: Risk typology is a required field.

data.name: RiesgoCreate033
data.value: The probability of occurrence of the risk is a required field.

data.name: RiesgoCreate034
data.value: The risk impact type is a required field.

data.name: RiesgoCreate035
data.value: The magnitude of risk impact is a required field.

data.name: RiesgoCreate036
data.value: Risk criticality is a required field.

data.name: RiesgoCreate038
data.value: The code can be up to 20 characters long.

data.name: RiesgoCreate042
data.value: -Select the person responsible for the control-

data.name: RiesgoCreate049
data.value: It complies with the initials "C" which indicates that it is control, followed by "SP" indicating that it is a Sub Process and continues with 4 digits, which correspond to the Sub Process code and 2 more digits that indicate the consecutive or number of risk we are working on. Control coding example: CSP1010-02 ".

data.name: RiesgoCreate050
data.value: Based on each of the identified risk events, the control activity (or activities), designed and in operation, existing to mitigate said risk must be described. The wording should indicate its two components: "what is the control and how is it carried out".

data.name: RiesgoCreate051
data.value: The evidence remaining as a result of the execution of the control will be described. Remember that the evidence must be consistent with the control activity, it is also proof that the control works correctly.

data.name: RiesgoCreate052
data.value: It is identified as the name of the person who is in charge of carrying out the control (the one who prepares a reconciliation, checks the data of an invoice, etc.), as a general rule the person responsible for the control and the executor should not be the same person In case it is reported like this, it must be validated if the information is correct since in principle it is understood that there is a problem of segregation of functions that must be solved.

data.name: RiesgoCreate053
data.value: The name of the person responsible for the operation of the control will be identified (normally it will not coincide with the person who executes the control, but will be at a higher hierarchical level, since it is usually the person who supervises that the control is carried out properly)

data.name: RiesgoCreate054
data.value: Each control activity will be classified with one of the following attributes, depending on the control's ability to mitigate the risk for which it has been designed: Key: The control completely mitigates on its own (or, together with another control, if which both controls would be key) the risk identified as relevant from the financial reporting point of view. Non-key: For a control activity to be defined as "non-key", the control activity must be mitigating a risk that is also being mitigated by other control / s ("key / keys") and / or the activity to which you are identified is not relevant

data.name: RiesgoCreate055
data.value: Indicate the degree to which the described control reduces or mitigates the associated operational risk, according to: Maximum coverage: The control activity minimizes the possibility of incurring some type of operational risk (generally these are systematized activities) Coverage high: The control activity reduces by a significant percentage the possibility of incurring some type of operational risk (generally these are semi-automated activities or activities with low risk probability of occurrence) Medium coverage: The control activity partially reduces the possibility of incurring some type of operational risk (generally these are manual activities or controls applied to risk activities of medium probability of occurrence) Small coverage: The control activity marginally reduces the possibility of incurring some type of operational risk (generally these are manual activities or controls applied to risk activities with a high probability of occurrence) Null coverage: The control activity does not contribute to risk mitigation, either because it is not very effective controls, or because it is applied to risk activities with the highest probability of occurrence.

data.name: RiesgoCreate056
data.value: The frequency will be specified for each of the existing control activities in each Sub-Process, according to what is indicated in the MRyC itself.

data.name: RiesgoCreate057
data.value: Catalog the control attributes according to their execution mode, according to: Manual: These are controls executed by people and are characterized because the execution of the control activity is normally accompanied by a greater or lesser degree of assessment. Automatic: These are controls executed by an application, so they have a mechanical nature. They are characterized because the execution of the control, once it has been designed, is not accompanied by a subjective assessment or the intervention of any person.

data.name: RiesgoCreate058
data.value: This aspect is only applicable in the event that there is a control activity supported or executed by a computer application, that is, it is an automatic control, and said computer application must be identified and the exact functionality that supports the control activity respecting the criteria indicated. for the relevant applications, in case of manual nature on behalf of the application, it should be noted.

data.name: RiesgoCreate059
data.value: Each control activity will be classified with one of the following attributes, based on its specific characteristics: Detective: Those control activities that aim to detect errors or fraud that have already occurred and could result in errors in the financial statements. Preventive: Those control activities that aim to prevent errors or fraud before they could occur and, therefore, become errors in the financial statements.

data.name: RiesgoCreate060
data.value: For each control activity, one of the categories of controls indicated by the MRyC itself will be identified.

data.name: RiesgoCreate061
data.value: Depending on the control evidence we have, we can choose between two options: Documentary: refers to the evidence being available in printed form, Magnetic: refers to the fact that it is available in electronic file.

data.name: RiesgoCreate062
data.value: If a control has corrective action, the same fields will not be required.

data.name: RiesgoCreate063
data.value: -Select the person in charge of control-

data.name: RiesgoCreate064
data.value: Corrective action is a required field

data.value: Select a person responsible for the Incident

data.name: RiesgoCreate066
data.value: Select a classification for the issue

data.name: RiesgoCreate068
data.value: Do you require a remediation plan?

data.name: RiesgoCreate070
data.value: Some measure must be indicated that the area has recognized that, by adopting it, contributes to mitigating the risk that has been identified. Said corrective action must describe the control activity to be carried out, indicating who is responsible for carrying it out, how often it will be carried out (daily, monthly, etc.), how it will be carried out, etc. A corrective action proposal is recorded when it is concluded that the control is NOT EFFECTIVE, or when it is identified that the hedge does not mitigate the risk, when we select a medium, small or null hedge, we could consider that we are in this case.

data.name: RiesgoCreate071
data.value: Select a person responsible for the Incident.

data.name: RiesgoCreate076
data.value: If you require a Remediation Plan, mark this box as "YES", otherwise, mark "NO" and record your justification for not requiring a remediation plan.

data.name: RiesgoCreate077
data.value: Write the reason why the incident does not need a Remediation Plan.

data.name: CertificacionCertificar007
data.value: The certification period that is being carried out will be put, for example July 01, December 01 and in case there are two certifications in the same month it would be July 02, December 02.

data.name: CertificacionCertificar008
data.value: Describe a brief detail of the test performed.

data.name: CertificacionCertificar009
data.value: Self-assessment: the person responsible for the control is the one who performs the test. Cross tests: These are tests carried out by people other than the person responsible for controlling the same area.
